description: Sven Halek formally advises the Council to authorize a forceful return to algorithmic control, mandating biometric and manual checks. Decision is made to restore BCI order at any cost and launch aggressive messaging campaign.
Dire warnings escalate as Council receives data on escalating BCI tampering. Directorate initiates emergency lockdown, deploying squads to enforce new checks and isolate suspected manipulation zones.
Residents begin experiencing rapid, unpredictable changes in BCI scores. Access to housing, work, and services shifts erratically, leading to confusion and frustration among all social ranks.
Neighborhood patrols self-organize, confronting citizens over suspicious score changes. Tensions spike as vigilantes and accused residents clash, fueling distrust.
Digital messages and graffiti urge the public to 'trust no score.' Crowds gather at service hubs, demanding restoration of order and clear communication from authorities.
